wikipedia_page.main: Stuart Blair Donaldson (born 5 September 1991) is a Scottish National Party (SNP) politician in the United Kingdom. He served as the Member of Parliament (MP) for West Aberdeenshire and Kincardine from the 2015 general election until being unseated at the general election on 8 June 2017, by Andrew Bowie of the Conservative Party.

response: Smith stood for reelection in the 2015 general election, but was defeated by Stuart Donaldson of the Scottish National Party.

response: ***Stuart Donaldson, SNP MP 2015–17. Son of Maureen.
Stuart Donaldson died at Carleton Hall, near Penrith in Cumberland, England on 11 January 1867.
*Stuart Donaldson, SNP MP for West Aberdeenshire and Kincardine (from 2015)

link_mentions.page: West Aberdeenshire and Kincardine (UK Parliament constituency)

response: His daughter, Maureen Watt, became an MSP in 2006, and his grandson, Stuart Donaldson, (Maureen's son) was elected in 2015 as the MP for West Aberdeenshire and Kincardine.

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish National Party MPs

response: Watt is the daughter of former SNP MP (1974–1979) Hamish Watt. She is married with two children. One of them, Stuart Donaldson, served as an SNP MP for Aberdeenshire West and Kincardine in the British Parliament between 2015 and 2017.
